front.title: Herokiller
front.setup: Place Behemoth into play, "Herokiller" side up. Remove all Movement cards from the villain deck, shuffle them, and put them aside as the Movement Deck

gameplay.p: Whenever Behemoth would deal damage, use Behemoth's current damage type.
At the start of the villain turn, if Behemoth has less than 30 HP, flip Behemoth.
At the start of the villain turn, play the top card of the Movement deck.
At the end of the villain turn, Behemoth deals each hero X damage, where X is the number of proximity tokens on the hero.

front.advanced: If a hero ever has 6 proximity tokens on them, they are immediately incapacitated

back.title: Herokiller, Desperate

gameplay.p: Whenever Behemoth would deal damage, use Behemoth's current damage type.
At the start of the villain turn, play the top card of the Movement deck.
Whenever Behemoth would be dealt damage of his current damage type, redirect the damage to the hero target with the lowest HP.
At the end of the villain turn, Behemoth deals each hero X damage, where X is the number of proximity tokens on the hero.
At the end of the villain turn, play the top card of the villain deck

back.advanced: If a hero ever has 6 proximity tokens on them, they are immediately incapacitated

deck.card:
Advance One-Shot Movement 2 Place a proximity token on every hero
Maintain a distance of at least a hundred feet from Behemoth at the very minimum.

card.name: Leap
card.text: Place 2 proximity tokens on a hero. Place 1 proximity token on the hero before and after that hero in the turn order

quote.text: With his claws and feet now on firm ground, he leaped. The shockwave of his departure toppled the slipshod buildings around him in his wake.

card.name: A Shift of Attention
card.text: Remove every proximity token from a hero. Place them all on a different hero

quote.text: This was his new tactic, burrowing, surfacing. But where was the retaliation? Their whole damn pattern centered around repaying us twice over for any abuse we inflicted on them.

card.name: No Safety
card.text: Move 1 proximity token from every hero to the hero with the least proximity tokens

quote.text: "...Assume every structure will fall down in a heartbeat, and know that there's no good place to hide and wait for this to be over."

card.name: Shift
card.text: Move all proximity tokens on each hero to the hero to their right

quote.text: "...Get any closer, you probably won't have a chance of escaping if he decides to close the gap..."

card.name: Focus
card.text: Place a proximity token on a hero

quote.text: "...Be mindful of line of sight, because he can and will tag you with a lightning bolt, and it's not something you can dodge..."

text.p: Behemoth's damage type is Sonic.
Behemoth deals 2 damage to all non-villain targets.

quote.text: The creature roared, and as invulnerable as she was, it almost hurt.

text.p: Behemoth's damage type is Lightning.
Behemoth deals 5 damage to a hero. That hero may move a proximity token to another hero.

quote.text: A lightning bolt flashed from the tip of Behemoth's claw, arcing around her and striking one of her subordinates in a single heartbeat, before leaving only the smell of ozone.

text.p: Behemoth's damage type is Energy.
Behemoth deals 2 damage to each hero target. Each hero may move a proximity token to another hero

quote.text: "He's a dynakinetic! He manipulates energy! No Manton limitation!"

text.p: Behemoth's damage type is Fire.
Behemoth deals H damage to any hero with 3 or more proximity tokens.

quote.text: When I looked back at the screen, nearly half of the city was on fire. Black smoke choked the skies, a stark contrast to the cloudy sky of only minutes ago.

text.p: When this card enters play, change Behemoth's damage type to Melee.
At the end of the villain turn, move a proximity token to the hero with the most proximity tokens

quote.text: Cryogenic beams, containment foam and more served to slow him down. Not stopping him. No, that was too much to hope for.

text.p: When this card enters play, change Behemoth's damage type to Sonic.
Reduce damage dealt to Behemoth by 1
Whenever a hero deals damage to Behemoth, move a proximity token to that hero.

quote.text: Forty-five feet tall at the very least, he climbed forth from underground. His skin was crusted with black stone that might have been obsidian, layers of what might have been cooled magma sloughing off of him as he planted his feet on the ground and stood straight.

text.p: When this card enters play, change Behemoth's damage type to Lightning.
Whenever a hero puts an Equipment or Ongoing card into play, Behemoth deals that hero 2 damage.

quote.text: I took off. Again, I tried my armband. Static. Better than nothing, but not ideal.

text.p: Behemoth's damage type is Lightning.
Destroy 2 hero cards and remove them from the game. Move 1 proximity token to a hero who owned one of the destroyed cards

quote.text: The Endbringer's path of destruction had continued more or less in one general direction, but beyond that, the damage was indiscriminate, indeterminate.

text.p: Behemoth's damage type is Melee
Destroy all environment cards
Destroy all ongoing cards
Destroy all equipment cards

quote.text: As far as the eye could see in every direction, terrain shifted. Hillsides abruptly tilted, standing structures fell like collapsing houses of cards.

text.p: Behemoth's damage type is Fire.
Destroy two ongoing cards. Move 1 proximity token from one of the heroes who owned one of the destroyed cards to another hero

quote.text: The man ignited from the inside out, flame and smoke pouring from every orifice as he was turned into a burned-out husk in a matter of seconds. His skeleton disintegrated into fine dust and ash as it crashed to the ground.
